prompt: Add an Azure SQL Database to the existing setup. Ensure it is available in the same network as the AKS so my service can connect.
Create a public Azure Blob Storage to store public images served on my website. Ensure it is accessible publicly and place it in the same resource group.
Integrate an Azure Log Analytics Workspace to monitor the AKS cluster.
Enable auto-scaling for the AKS cluster to automatically adjust the number of nodes based on CPU utilization. Scale to a maximum of 10 nodes.
Refactor the resource group creation into a separate submodule to promote reusability. But keep in mind that the state should be updated accordingly when new files are created.
Add an Azure Virtual Network with three subnets: one for the AKS cluster, one for the Key Vault, and one for the SQL Database.
Add policies to the VNet, so the aks can access the keyvault and the DB.
Integrate an Azure Application Gateway to manage traffic to the AKS cluster.
Deploy an Azure VPN Gateway for secure network traffic to the resources.
Configure Azure Key Vault to store and manage secrets for the AKS cluster, ensuring the AKS cluster can access these secrets securely.
